title: This country seemed to do everything right. Coronavirus spread anyway
description: Peru was one of the first nations in the Americas to take strict preventative coronavirus measures, like stay-at-home orders, curfews and border closings. So how did it become one of the hardest hit?

title: The largest volcano in the world sits beneath two small rocky peaks in Hawaii
description: With two barren peaks that rise only about 170 feet above sea level, the now extinct Pūhāhonu volcano in the Northwestern Hawaii Islands doesn't look like much. This is especially true since in the same archipelago, Mauna Loa towers over every other volcano at 30,000 feet.

title: Brazil faces dark week as Covid-19 toll rises
How sex workers are surviving in the age of social distancing
description: Don't kiss. Tell clients to wash their hands before they touch you. Wear a mask. Avoid face-to-face positions. And even: Put on a nurse costume and pull out a thermometer -- if his temperature is normal, make it part of the game. If he has a fever, end the session.

title: How coronavirus hypocrisy is tarnishing Boris Johnson's government
description: When British Prime Minister Boris Johnson was fighting for his life last month, his chief adviser Dominic Cummings was dealing with his own Covid-related battle.

title: Brazilian president called mayor 'a piece of s***.' See mayor's response.
description: Brazil now has the second most infections worldwide after the United States, but its president Jair Bolsonaro, is urging business to reopen. CNN's Nick Paton Walsh tells us more.

title: Trump threatens to pull Republican convention out of North Carolina
description: President Donald Trump began a solemn Memorial Day railing against North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper, a Democrat, ahead of the 2020 Republican National Convention, threatening to pull it out of Charlotte, where the convention is expected to be held August 24 to 27.

title: Elon Musk and Grimes have changed their baby's name. A bit
description: Just when you thought you'd learned how to spell Grimes and Elon Musk's unusual baby name, they've gone and changed it.

title: Astronomers discover 'cosmic ring of fire' formed when two galaxies collide
description: Images of Galaxy R5519 show a rare "cosmic ring of fire" thought to have formed when two galaxies collide.

title: Lufthansa clinches $10 billion bailout
description: Lufthansa and the German government have finalized the terms of a €9 billion ($9.8 billion) bailout, following weeks of intense negotiations over the future of Europe's leading global airline.

title: Renault and Nissan are desperate for help
description: The coronavirus pandemic may be forcing Renault and Nissan to rethink their strained relationship.

title: Pixar short 'Out' features the studio's first gay lead character
description: Pixar's new short film "Out" is reminiscent of classic Disney body-swap comedies like "Freaky Friday" and the "Shaggy Dog" movies, but it's also a first for the studio, because its main character is gay.

title: Footballers emerge from lockdown with some unexpected new looks
description: For some 21st century footballers, how they look on the pitch is almost as important as how they play.

title: Airbnb hosts are planning to sell off their properties because of the pandemic
description: Amy Offield always dreamed of running a vacation rental in Galveston, Texas. Five years ago, she and her husband Chris got their wish and bought a house there minutes away from the beach. They immediately began restoring the property, which she named the "Blue Skies Beach Bungalow," adding vintage items as well as retro and bright-colored decor.

title: Queen guitarist Brian May rushed to hospital after heart attack
description: Queen guitarist Brian May has revealed that he was rushed to the hospital by his doctor after suffering a heart attack.

title: The US Air Force is removing height restrictions for pilots, which will allow more women to serve
description: The US Air Force has removed its minimum height requirements for prospective pilots, doing away with a barrier that had disadvantaged women.

title: Amazon 'may worry' about this competitor
description: An online grocery business backed by Asia's richest man is expanding to hundreds of cities across India — a move widely seen as a challenge to Amazon and FlipKart.

title: Scientists discover giant fiery doughnut-shaped galaxy
description: A team of scientists has discovered a galaxy that looks like a "cosmic ring of fire" and could help us understand more about how galactic structures form and evolve.

title: Why Donald Trump's wild weekend can't be normalized
Royal reveals what scares him about being a father
description: Prince William opened up in a new BBC documentary "Football, Prince William and Our Mental Health," about grief over the loss of his mother, Princess Diana, that resurfaced when he became a father.

title: Tom Brady hits incredible shot, then splits his trousers
description: It was a mouth-watering prospect for sports-starved fans everywhere. Four of the greatest athletes the world has ever known, on the golf course at the same time, offering us a glimpse of who they are when they aren't winning Major Championships and Super Bowl trophies.

title: Trump trashes one of his greatest allies during TV interview
description: President Donald Trump escalated his feud with former attorney general Jeff Sessions by saying he was not "mentally qualified" for the job.

title: Delta and United Airlines caught up in rising US-China tensions
description: Rising tensions between the United States and China are spilling over into the airline industry.

title: I was trapped naked on a German fire escape
description: It's 10 years ago. I'm on a road trip to Germany with my then boyfriend.

title: Boris Johnson draws media fire from all sides after top aide accused of lockdown breach
description: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson has managed the rare feat of bringing together British newspapers from across the political spectrum to demand he sack a top aide accused of breaking strict lockdown rules.

title: Rwanda has enlisted anti-epidemic robots in its fight against coronavirus
description: Rwanda has introduced robots as part of its fight against coronavirus.

title: Health officials warned to look out for rare condition that almost took this boy's life
description: "The doctors were shocked. They said they had never seen anything like this," says Valentina Vigilante, recalling the terrifying day her 6-year-old son Nicolò was rushed into intensive care in Bergamo, northern Italy, as he struggled to breathe.

title: New Zealand PM shook by earthquake during TV interview
description: The coronavirus pandemic has been something of a nightmare for live TV, with interviews interrupted by children, cats, ringing phones, dogs and now, earthquakes.

title: Earthquake hits during Jacinda Ardern's live interview
description: A magnitude 5.8 earthquake struck near New Zealand's capital Wellington while the country's Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern was discussing New Zealand's ongoing lifting of coronavirus restrictions in a live interview.

title: The pandemic is causing an exponential rise in the online exploitation of children, experts say
description: At first glance, Shelley Allwang's cubicle looks just like any other office space.

title: Women are told more lies than men in workplace reviews, new research suggests. And that can prevent gender equality.
description: Turns out, gender bias in the workplace is just as detrimental as you may think.

title: Twitter remains silent about Trump's appalling attack against Joe Scarborough
description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

title: Rare natural event happens amid virus crisis
description: James Wood is looking for a tree.

title: Kirby Jenner, the 'fraternal twin' of Kendall Jenner, steps into the spotlight
description: There's a new reality show from the Kardashian-Jenner family, but it has a twist. The show centers around a 24-year-old performance artist who has risen to fame over the past five years with his parody Instagram account, where he pretends to be the fraternal twin brother of Kendall Jenner.

title: Aerial video shows holiday crowd in Daytona Beach
description: Video released by the Volusia County Sheriff's Office shows a crowd of people not socially distancing while celebrating Memorial Day weekend in Daytona Beach, Florida. A person making a rap video caused a disturbance when they began throwing money from a car, according to Sheriff Mike Chitwood. CNN's Ana Cabrera talks to Mayor Derrick Henry about how the city is managing during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Biscuits and Gravy, the kitten born with two faces, dies
description: Biscuits and Gravy, the kitten with two faces, has died days after capturing the hearts of animal lovers all over the world.
